title: Why did David Gilmore choose to play a Fender Stratocaster over a Gibson? - Quora

response.answer_text: A Gibson would be well suited for David’s lead style, except that he likes to use the whammy bar a lot and a bigsby on a Gibson wouldn't sound quite the same. Also, besideS his lead playing he’s an amazing texturalist, and Gibsons always retain a certain, bulk to their sound that makes them less suited for minimalistic textural guitar playing than a Stratocaster, which can sound fluid and soaring for leads with the right effects. Also the ‘feel’ of each is significantly different so he most likely finds the Stratocaster more comfortable to play. By the way, the ‘Another Brick In the wall pt 2’ solo was done with a Les Paul with P90s.
You’d have to ask Gilmour. Guitar choices are absolutely personal. People play the instruments that feel and sound best to them.
